items.content: Are God’s callings for men and women merely functional and practical, or do they flow from something deeper in his design?

items.title: One Day Tolerance Will End
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: We live in the day of salvation, the day of patience, the day of tolerance. But when Jesus returns, that day will end forever.

items.title: On Cigarettes, Vaping, and Nicotine

items.title: Does God Command Our Praise for His Sake or Ours?
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: Pleasure in God is not complete unless it overflows in praise to God. And praise to God is not sincere unless it overflows from pleasure in God.

items.content: Joy in God was never meant to be a solitary pursuit. Joy sends us out to serve — and serving fills us up with joy.

items.title: Why Did God Make Me Unattractive?

items.content: Few of us feel as attractive as we would like, and some of us feel downright ugly. Why does God allow such unattractiveness in a world that prizes physical beauty?

items.title: The Church’s Calling in an Age of Recreational Pot

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: Does Christ Rule the Nations Now?
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: If Christ has all authority in heaven and on earth, does he rule over the nations now? Or is he waiting to exercise his rule until his second coming?
items.contentSnippet: If Christ has all authority in heaven and on earth, does he rule over the nations now? Or is he waiting to exercise his rule until his second coming?

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: You Don’t Know God If You Don’t Love Christ
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: If you want to know whether others love God, ask if they love the Jesus of Scripture. Love for Jesus is the litmus test of love for God.
items.contentSnippet: If you want to know whether others love God, ask if they love the Jesus of Scripture. Love for Jesus is the litmus test of love for God.

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: Is Death Past, Present, or Future?
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: According to Paul, Christians have died, will die, and die every day. What do these different deaths mean, and how else does Scripture speak of our dying?
items.contentSnippet: According to Paul, Christians have died, will die, and die every day. What do these different deaths mean, and how else does Scripture speak of our dying?

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: Six Dangers of Podcasts
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: Podcasts, including Christian podcasts, have great potential for both good and evil. Pastor John explains six dangers to beware of as you listen.

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: Living the Mystery of Joy in Suffering
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: Christians are sorrowful, yet always rejoicing: sorrowful because of the ugliness and horrors of sin, and rejoicing because of the infinite worth of Jesus.
items.contentSnippet: Christians are sorrowful, yet always rejoicing: sorrowful because of the ugliness and horrors of sin, and rejoicing because of the infinite worth of Jesus.

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: If All My Sins Are Forgiven, Why Pursue Holiness?
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: If Christ already paid for all our sins — past, present, and future — then why do we need to work so hard to put sin to death and grow in holiness?

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: Is Sex During Menstruation Sinful?
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: The Old Testament prohibited a husband and wife from having sex during menstruation. Is that command still in force today?

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: Controversy Is Essential — and Deadly
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: Controversy is essential — and deadly. Slowly, we can begin to care more about defending the truth than enjoying the truth.

items.title: How Do We Pray in the Spirit?
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: What do Paul and Jude mean when they command Christians to pray “in the Spirit” — and what would it mean to pray “out of the Spirit”?

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: If We Read Our Bibles, Why Do We Need Sermons?
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: The Bible is perfect; preachers are not. So, why listen to the sermons of fallible men when we can read God’s infallible word for ourselves?

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: How to Argue Like a Calvinist
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: John Newton cherished the doctrines of grace. And he knew that the best way to commend them was with a spirit of graciousness.

items.creator: John Piper
items.title: Can I Marry a Woman Half My Age?
items.dc:creator: John Piper
items.content: The Bible doesn’t say how old Christians should be when they marry — or how close in age. So, can a Christian marry someone significantly younger?
